attributes.action: Disqualify anyone convicted of a criminal offence from being an MP
attributes.background: As those who make our laws and expect UK citizens to abide by them, elected MP's should be expected to conduct themselves to the highest standards. If convicted whilst in office, they should lose their seat and a by-election held.

attributes.action: Publish Northern Ireland (no border) planning papers in a no-deal Brexit
attributes.background: The government has published numerious technical notices for a no-deal Brexit outcome. Information provided covers a wide range of topics, from pet travel requirements to pharmaceuticals. Since EU can't stop the UK from a no-deal Brexit, what are the governments unilateral contingency plans for N.I.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/how-to-prepare-if-the-uk-leaves-the-eu-with-no-deal#overview

attributes.action: Make a governmental apology for the massacre at Jalianwala Bagh (Amritsar 1919)
attributes.background: April 2019 will mark 100 Years since the bloody Vaisakhi of 1919 when a massacre was carried against the people of Punjab in which several hundreds at least lost their lives. We must never forget the tyranny of the 'Butcher of Amritsar' General Reginald Dyer.

attributes.action: Change smoking warnings to include the benefits of stopping smoking
attributes.background: Smoking warnings are scare stories that may impact people but they are all one sided and only convey the negative aspects of smoking. Why not include the positive aspects of stopping smoking. Short texts documenting the benefits along with the negative could work better than the usual scare stories.
attributes.additional_details:
On the NHS website the first lines on the what happens when you stop smoking page are - Stopping smoking can make a drastic improvement to your lifestyle and health in ways you might not expect. 
And 
Once you stop smoking, some of the benefits are immediate and some are longer-term.
They then include personal stories of people who quit smoking. The question is which approach works better? The warnings or the benefits? Or even a mix of both? It seems that the one sided approach is naive at best.

attributes.action: Make landlords of privately owned student property liable for council tax
attributes.background: In the last 10 years, as the uni near my home has grown, landlords have bought and extended many properties in the area and let them to students, who all use the services provided by the council.   No one is paying for their  use of local council services eg rubbish collection.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the properties, 3 bed family homes with average sized families, have been extended so there are 8-10 students in some. They require extra refuse bins, extra demand on health services and extra policing. Landlords are earning a minimum of £120 per room per week so can afford and should be paying for the extra services the student population uses. The extra revenue would help to pay for local health and social care costs.

attributes.action: Parliament to allow the electorate to have a yes or no referendum on referendums
attributes.background: We the public are being constantly told we must have another referendum for different issues. Do we as a country want to have them in our constitution, do we have a vote on the same issue every 2 or 5 years like some want on the EU issue.
attributes.additional_details:
Some requests for referendums on the petition website: 
Hold a referendum on the final Brexit deal 
Stop possible second referendum on E.U. membership 
Hold a referendum for the legalisation of cannabis 
In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment 
All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future. 
Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections

attributes.action: Make it an offence to share film footage of assault with intent to humiliate.
attributes.background: Too many young people are sharing footage of fights and assaults with the intent to humiliate the innocent victims.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the UK government to make it illegal to share film footage on social media or via phone to phone where the intent is to humiliate the victim. An example being the young innocent girl who was seriously assaulted and then the footage was shared with the intent to cause her further distress.

attributes.action: Call to ban ‘cruel’ pupil restraint in special schools
attributes.background: Hundreds of children have suffered injuries while being physically restrained in special schools. Teachers throw children to the ground, hold them so tightly it still hurts the next day and don’t talk to them when they are in distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Something has to be done. 
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39530915

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on our EU membership, but this time including the Euro
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU referendum, there were 2 choices: Leave or Remain. We had our say. But there is a third-way: let's call it Re-Join. No more opt-outs. No more pound, even. Proper EU membership, like Germany and France. Are we so sure we want to leave, versus just joining up properly like the rest?
attributes.additional_details: The past two years have seen plenty of surprises with respect to the EU, some unpleasant. But like the turkeys who don't vote for Christmas, nobody in Westminster is offering us the one EU choice that might actually be worth considering: full membership, including the Euro. It could be our country's best bet, though. No more pound, yes. But no need for one, if our banks are built not to need bailing out in the first place. As for jobs, let's just say the sucking sound would be in our direction.

attributes.action: Fund more research into Endometriosis
attributes.background: Endometriosis is the name given to the condition where cells like the ones in the lining of the womb (uterus) are found elsewhere in the body. The actual cause of endometriosis is unknown. Around 1.5 million women in the UK are currently living with the condition.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 women of reproductive age in the UK suffer from endometriosis.
 
Endometriosis is the second most common gynaecological condition in the UK.
 
Endometriosis affects 1.5 million women, a similar number of women affected by diabetes.
 
On average it takes 7.5 years from onset of symptoms to get a diagnosis.
 
Endometriosis costs the UK economy £8.2bn a year in treatment, loss of work and healthcare costs.
 
https://www.endometriosis-uk.org/information

attributes.action: Amend Royal Charter to stop BBC paying more than twice Prime Minister’s salary
attributes.background: The BBC is a public service and should not pay excessive salaries or other payments to individuals. Paying anyone over £1.5m a year to watch and comment on sport or present a 3 hour radio show is too much. Alternative talent could be found at lower salary levels.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly funded bodies have shown disregard for financial discipline and the BBC may be the worst. If commercial entities want to pay their staff excessive salaries and perks let their shareholders approve it or otherwise. The taxpayers are the BBC shareholders and I say enough is enough. who work primarily for the BBC should also pay tax and NI like everyone else at source. The talent will evolve to fill any gaps.

attributes.action: Change age limit for large engine cars as it is for motorbikes
attributes.background: I want it changed as is for motorbikes so young people can not drive cars above a 1.2 engine till they are 25 so can help reduce risk of fatal or life changing injures
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was in car crash with young lad at wheel in large engine car and crashed car ended up on roof and she was injured two broken ankles deep cut to leg and now has too have two surgery

attributes.action: Make standard code of practice for safety in soft play & indoor play mandatory
attributes.background: As a parent of 3 children,I know just how popular soft play centres can be for families. With UK weather, they are often needed as fair weather place for children to play. Just as the amount of centres in the UK increase, so do the amount of incidents including harm to children. Regulation is needed
attributes.additional_details:
There are many cases that have been reported in the news of incidents at soft play, which include:
Accidents:
https://www.netmums.com/coffeehouse/being-mum-794/children-4-11-years-60/759544-soft-play-centres-accidents.html
Bullying & Harm:
https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/whats-on/family-kids/mum-bullied-abused-playcentre-having-2029547
Food Hygeine
https://www.gazettelive.co.uk/news/teesside-news/investigation-play-factory-vomiting-outbreak-14443979

attributes.action: Fund 12yr olds to visit Menin Gate &15yr olds to visit Auschwitz and Birkenau.
attributes.background: The rise of anti Semitism & apparent devaluing of the armed forces & their role in maintaining our democracy, there are lessons to be learnt by young people ACTUALLY seeing the scale of the horror & to establish a connection between them & the sacrifice and values that helped create modern Britain.
attributes.additional_details: I learned about World Wars at school and read about Hitler and the Nazis subsequently. I visited the Meningate and war graves in France and Belgium and paid my respects. But I did not envisage the profound reaction that a recent visit to Auschwitz and Birkenau had on my husband, friends and me. The industrial scale of the genocide was evident before our eyes. Lectures and books cannot fully capture the scale. The past MUST not be forgotten.

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be sold in registered gun shops
attributes.background:
Restrict the sale of fireworks to just registered gun dealers. Gun dealers are competent and qualified in firearms and ammunition so are certainly the right people for judging whom they sell too.
 This will prevent fireworks from falling into the hands of youths and the wrong people.

attributes.action: Post-Study Work Visa for International Students after completion of Course.
attributes.background: IISAU on behalf of all International students studying in the UK appeals to reintroduce post-study work visa for international students after completion of the degree program.
attributes.additional_details: Indian International students and Alumni Union is raising the voice for all International students in UK. The Migration Advisory Committee recommended an automatic period of leave to remain after studies complete. A post-study work visa would make the UK a more attractive destination for international students and graduates, enabling it to compete with other popular destinations such as the United States, Australia, and Canada who have more welcoming student visa policies.

attributes.action: Consistently implement the Metric System across the UK
attributes.background: The Metric system has only been partially integrated into public life. We measure fuel in litres, speed in mph. Government policy is beer is sold in pints, while other alcohol such as spirits & wine to be sold in litres & ml. The government should implement the metric system in all law & regulation.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrepancy in selling of alcohol:
https://www.gov.uk/weights-measures-and-packaging-the-law/specified-quantities

Examples (as recent as 2000 in the UK) of where conversion errors have caused issues with infrastructure and technology:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-27509559

Inconsistency in non metric measurements - the difference between UK and US Imperial measurements:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/skillswise/factsheet/ma21impe-l1-f-converting-imperial-and-metric

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: Make domestic abuse punishments more severe.
attributes.background: 1 in 5 children in the UK have witnessed domestic abuse, this can psychologically torment and haunt these young, innocent, minds. With more support from the government we could make the punishment more severe to make people thing twice before they partake in this disgusting crime.
attributes.additional_details:
Only 46% of domestic abuse crimes ended in arrests in 2007 which deters others from reporting the abuse.
70% of all domestic abuse stories are female.
On average an individual will have been abused 35 times before reporting.
Domestic abuse costs the public £23 billion each year.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to leave children under 13 home alone
attributes.background: There is currently no age restriction for a child being given the responsibility of staying at home alone as long as it’s not overnight and that isn’t “in a manner likely to cause unnecessary suffering or injury to health”.
attributes.additional_details:
This is NOT right, there are a range of issues including safeguarding of children. As parents and carers we have a duty to our children.

The petition is aimed to try to implement a law that states that no child under the age of 13 should be left alone at any given time, the reason for this is due to safeguarding and putting a huge responsibility on children regardless of their mental age. We are not allowed to leave children alone overnight and the same rules must apply throughout the day too. I understand a child must be given due responsibility but under the age of 13 should not be allowed due to risks and safety.

attributes.action: Let people 17 and over get tattoos with parental consent
attributes.background: This petition is to let people get tattoos at the age of 17 with parental consent. Some people get tattoos when drunk. This would not be the case if it was made so that 17 year olds needed parental consent. They wouldn't be drunk with their parents so I think it would be perfectly reasonable.

attributes.action: Urge Bank of England to return to traditional 'paper' banknotes
attributes.background: Keep existing 'paper* £20 & £50 and recall existing polymer notes. The public prefer beautiful 'paper' banknotes.
attributes.additional_details:
*Paper money: Traditionally manufactured textile-mix notes of folding currency; such as the US Dollar (75% cotton 25% linen). {as compared to polymer i.e. plastic notes - introduced to UK circulation Sep' 2016}

Polymer banknotes are not worthy of the dignity of a national currency.
Slippery to the touch and handle.
Prone to flying out of control, e.g. from wallet or the hand.
Unpredictably stick together. 
Will not fold or stay folded, to store easily in
wallets/pockets etc.
Don't sit securely within cash-till draws.
Difficult to count up - on a table the notes will not stack up, they slide away in disorder and bounce about.
Alternative security features are available to make 'paper'-notes as secure.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory on streets where crime doubles in 6 months.
attributes.background: Hotspots of escalating crime figures are indications of organised crime where false reporting and framing of individuals for crimes they didnt commit can become more likely. CCTV is advisable on streets where crime figures double in 6 months
attributes.additional_details: Sign the petition and change the law so CCTV stops gangs lying to the police

attributes.action: Bring in a recognised standard of safety for installation of blinds.
attributes.background: For years the blind industry has the good and the bad installers, which is the same in a lot of industries but this can be the case of life or death when cords are involved.
attributes.additional_details: There are many cases of children losing their lives to poorly installed blinds due to the cording.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of homework received by primary school students.
attributes.background: Being a student myself, I know the struggle. Children in primary education receive an unnecessary amount of homework each week, and need to be enjoying their childhood, and being more active. The only important homework is reading and spellings.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the homework they receive is sometimes difficult to understand, and not always relevant to their learning. Not only do the students feel pressurised at such a young age, but it can also cause conflict at home between the student and their parents. This is due to the parents also feeling stressed.

attributes.action: BAN letting TWO persons ride on a moped together
attributes.background: Whist in London taking pictures of Shard near Tower of London. Moped with two passengers mounted pavement, came from behind and as passed across the front of my nephew the back seat passenger grabbed the tripod i/c camera and carried on up the road weaving in and out dangerously with traffic.
attributes.additional_details: More than 60 crimes using mopeds or motorbikes were carried out every day in London alone on average over the past year - a 50% increase on the previous 12 months.

attributes.action: Make schools provide 20 mins planned exercise each day to tackle rising obesity.
attributes.background:
Planned exercise should be fun, incorporating lifestyle / healthy eating guidance:
- Prevention is better than cure / better than keep bemoaning pressure on NHS etc
- Learning at school should be about whole person and their future life chances, not just the constraints of the curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
This should be in ALL schools. In primary schools the data from the National Child Measurement Programme could be used to measure progress.
Educational attainment would be expected to increase as a result.

Some factors:
- Screen time: video games, mobiles etc
- Taxi of Mum/Dad
- Over-protective parents limiting kids' freedom to roam
- Erosion of PE time in primary schools by pressure of needing academic success for league tables
- Erosion of play/break times and dinner time by same pressure

attributes.action: Up grade the A34 to motorway standard.
attributes.background: The A34 is a major road linking motorways, it regularly suffers from road closures due to accidents. These affect the economy and cause major problems on surrounding roads as there is no suitable alternative route.  It has been stated by numerous people that the A34 is no longer fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Lower the NHS charges at dentists
attributes.background: The NHS charges at dentists are becoming more akin to private treatment and beyond the budget of ordinary people. The result is that people suffer poor dental health because they can't afford the cost.
attributes.additional_details: The average cost of seeing a Dental Hygienist is now £59. A 6 monthly check up is over £30 and if work needs doing, it can be hundreds of pounds.

attributes.action: Funding home visits in times of crisis by trained mental health professionals
attributes.background: After a local woman tried to take her life, the community were left horrified in discovering proper professional help was not available to her, and she was left for hours before receiving the help she needed.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling for more funding and correct training for these circumstances so that no one needing help in times of crisis are left without it. This woman was fortunate to have a strong community of neighbours who were able to help her.

It's easy to point the finger and say people in need should seek help, but what happens when the help just isn't there?

attributes.action: The United Kingdom should have its very own  Interstellar Space Force.
attributes.background: In order to maintain close ties with our greatest ally, the United States, I call upon the UK government to pledge to the nation that we will introduce a bill for the establishment of a new branch of the Armed Forces - our very own Space Force.
attributes.additional_details: We just need it.

attributes.action: Make "vlogging" whilst driving illegal
attributes.background: Many youtubers are creating vlog videos whilst driving where they are talking to and looking at their camera and therefore becoming distracted from the road and becoming dangers to themselves and other road users. This will be encouraging others, especially young inexperienced drivers to do the same
attributes.additional_details: Vlogging is a form of online video blog usually shared via YouTube in which an individual talks to a camera, adrressing the audience. 100s of vlogs and drive with me videos can be accessed at the click of button. Those featured in these vlogs are popular young adults acting as role models for young and vulnerable teenagers who won't always realise they can be putting their own and other lives at risk if they are inspired to copy the actions as the youtubers face no consequence for their actions

attributes.action: Require ride-sharing services to give drivers equity to operate in the UK
attributes.background: To get a license to operate in the UK, all "gig economy" types of companies such as Uber, Gett, Deliveroo, etc. would be required to designate a pool of equity (or cash from its sale) to its workers. This would be distributed on a negotiated per mile/hour basis + a 'time on network' + rating policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect Intelligent Systems Workers

Any worker who contributes to an intelligent network, AI or algorithm that will put their long-term work at risk should participate in the long-term equity success of that network or system because they are helping to build it.

The government should make this equity grant a requirement of entry into any city or town and should hold in escrow either equity, funds or both to protect the longterm future of these intelligent systems workers. 

www.found.ee/taxi

attributes.action: Make more council houses available for part rent, part buy
attributes.background: I'm a working dad of 2 children under 2 year old. Me and my partner can't afford to live together as I don't earn enough to support us and pay private rent. The Government should introduce a scheme to make more council homes available for families to part rent part buy to get on the property ladder.
attributes.additional_details: More and more families are struggling to live together with young children. My children are 14 month old and a 2 week old. Like a lot of families me and my partner can’t afford to live together as I work full time and she doesn't as she raises the children. The systems we have in this country don't help people who work. Help to buy is only good if you can afford to save but with young children and paying rent that's more than a mortgage, it's hard to save.

attributes.action: Exempt all childcare for children and young people with disabilities
attributes.background: Parents and carers are required to pay VAT 20% on top of their childcare, which puts families in financial difficulties. This will reflect negatively on the family and child’s welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Child care for children and young people should be counted as a Disability service and be made Tax-Free.

attributes.action: Make smoking tobacco illegal
attributes.background:
We all know smoking is bad for us. There are tonnes of scientific evidence proving this. 

But it doesn't just affect the person smoking. It affects everyone since it pollutes the air and gets into the lungs of a person nearby and, in the long-term, can cause cancer, lung disease etc.
attributes.additional_details:
We've known about these risks for a long time, and the NHS have started a Stop Smoking scheme. But, although it is good, it's not good enough. There are still people smoking and affecting not only their own health but those around them. 78,000 people in the UK a year are still dying from smoking.

And, besides, not many people like breathing in the terrible smoke cigarettes produce. So, if you want to make our air cleaner and save 78,000 lives a year, sign this petition.

attributes.action: Make Homework voluntary for students in Secondary School
attributes.background: Homework should be voluntary as children with a high homework load often suffer from mental health problems such as anxiety and depression. The homework given to a child should be limited and not compulsory to allow time to relax, enjoy physical activities and to sleep.

attributes.action: make school weeks become four days instead of five
attributes.background: I think we should have four days at school because five days is way too much because after 4 days you just get tiered of being at school and begin to get slack on you’re work so if we had four days I think everyone would be more enthusiastic about school.
attributes.additional_details: I have seen that on every Friday of the week people are slacking because they are so tiered from the rest of the week this is why we should have a four day school week

attributes.action: An extra £1 taken from every tax payer to go directly toward local NHS services.
attributes.background: Many people are concerned by privatisation of NHS services. As a preventative measure, each tax paying adult is to give an extra £1 per month from their main source of income, which will go directly towards funding local NHS services.

attributes.action: Extend article 50 and call for a 'Citizen's Assembly' to resolve Brexit crisis
attributes.background: The Brexit debate has caused a deep societal divide in Britain which cannot be resolved by either pushing a 'no deal', 'no Brexit' or Teresa May's failed deal. A Citizen's Assembly, rather than a divisive second referendum, can heal this divide, but this needs time.
attributes.additional_details:
The time has come that the decision is given back to the people, not by a divisive second referendum but a healing, and unifying Citizen's Assembly.
A Citizen's Assembly worked very well in Ireland to heal the divide over abortion.

attributes.action: Remove all right to buy legislation (including voluntary RTB) from all  Statutes
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that Social Housing has been and continues to be, damaged by Right to Buy legislation. We believe that this legislation must be removed from Statutory legislation.
attributes.additional_details: Research has shown that a high percentage of Social Housing sold under Right to Buy legislation has created a sub market for private landlords which has forced up the cost of welfare rental payments to the detriment of all tax payers.

attributes.action: Stronger sentences for abandoning dogs and cats in public places
attributes.background: There are far too many Dogs and Cats just Dumped on the Roads and other Public Spaces, it does NOT make sense when there are Rescue places who will take them, the ones who do this do NOT have any concern to what happens to them, seeing Dogs are man’s best friend it is Cruel and lacking Respect.
attributes.additional_details: There has been many such cases like the car that was caught on CCTV throwing its bed out and the dog trying to say, You have Forgotten Me, dumped in sealed boxes, one dog tied to a post outside a Rescue place when they just could have taken it in, Animals are NOT a throwaway item and need more Protection.

attributes.action: Stop government from putting pensioners who claim pension credit on UC
attributes.background: In May this year, Amber Rudd is to bring in that a couple where the older person claims pension credit and has a partner younger will lose a lot of money, because the government will be putting them on universal credit, which means you could lose about £400 to £900 a month.

attributes.action: Begin a root and branch review to overhaul the UK's current political system
attributes.background:
We are proud that the UK is the 'mother' of parliaments but as has been shown during the Brexit process. She is no longer effective or efficient in serving its people.

We ask for an independent, root and branch review of the current political system here in the UK to make it better.

attributes.action: Promise to rebate all tariffs imposed by EU on UK exports.
attributes.background: Because the balance of trade with the EU is massively in UK favour, we could rebate every penny paid in export taxes on goods going to EU. By doing this there would be zero effect on cost of UK goods in the EU because any export tariffs will be refunded.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the House of Commons library statistics 30th Nov 2018: 
 
UK exports to EU = £274 billion 
UK imports from the EU = £341 billion 
Assume a nominal tariff of 11% both ways: 
£274B * 0.11 = £30B 
£341B * 0.11 = £37.5B 
Therefore if we rebate the £30 Billion to UK manufacturing, we would make a profit of £7.5 Billion. There’s a few hospitals right there!

attributes.action: London workers living outside its boundary should vote in Mayoral elections.
attributes.background: London workers spend days each week providing labour, skills and expertise in our capital. Many businesses would fail without this army of commuters adding to London's economy. Having made this contribution, they have no vote when it comes to choosing its Mayor.

attributes.action: Allow Polish people freedom of movement after the Brexit.
attributes.background: We owe the Polish for fighting the Germans in WW2 in the air and on the ground. This is fact.
attributes.additional_details: The Polish are very patriotic people and should be allowed with open arms into the UK.

attributes.action: Parents who do Not Exercise their Duties, should lose their Parental Rights!
attributes.background: I want the law to change by taking parental responsibility from inactive parents, this would give ease to the 'Actual' Responsible Parents. It would prevent parents who are not involved in their children’s’ lives taking decisions whether it’s good for their welfare or not.
attributes.additional_details:
Absent Parents having Parental Responsibility, creates more pain & stress for the Active parent, making decisions difficult, such as: 
-Whether or not a child has medical treatment. 
-Child’s name change 
-Consent for a child go holiday etc.
 
Like being a single hardworking parent isn't difficult enough, Imagine having to ask a careless or abusive ex for "permission", or the stress & cost of courts, having to explain why we shouldn't need to get permission from an "Absent" (by choice) parent.

attributes.action: Reduce the number of days in a year a workers union can strike to 12 days a year
attributes.background: Over the last 12 months union strikes have disrupted public transport. At the moment operators like Northern have been striking every Saturday since October 2018. I would like to  introduce a cap of 12 days a year for unions to use for there strike days.

attributes.action: Parliamentary Code of Conduct for Members of Parliament to be amended.
attributes.background: No MP, their immediate family partners or spouses may hold any offshore account exempt from UK Income Tax in order to ensure integrity in Office.
attributes.additional_details:
The Armed Forces of the United Kingdom abide by the Codes of Conduct that are integral to the maintenance and the upholding of the highest moral standards so as to be beyond reproach in their actions.  It is proposed that transparency, honesty, courage and discipline be returned to the Houses of Parliament.  
https://www.army.mod.uk/media/5219/20180910-values_standards_2018_final.pdf
